rules.note: phpinfo page found — exposes PHP config and possible secrets.
rules.recommendation: Remove phpinfo.php from webroot, rotate any exposed secrets.

rules.note: PHP detected — older PHP versions are commonly vulnerable or EOL.
rules.recommendation: Confirm exact PHP version and upgrade to a supported release.

rules.note: Apache web server detected; versions may be vulnerable.
rules.recommendation: Check Apache version, disable unused modules, apply patches.

rules.note: Nginx detected; verify config and patch level.
rules.recommendation: Update nginx, review exposed endpoints and headers.

rules.note: Open ports/services detected by nmap.
rules.recommendation: Review which services are required and restrict via firewall.

rules.note: SSH open — legitimate but must be secured.
rules.recommendation: Enforce key-based auth, disable password auth, restrict by IP.

rules.note: FTP service is accessible (cleartext credential risk).
rules.recommendation: Disable FTP or limit; use SFTP/FTPS and enforce auth.

rules.note: Anonymous FTP allowed — may permit data exfil/upload.
rules.recommendation: Disable anonymous login and audit uploaded files.

rules.note: TLS/SSL detected; perform detailed TLS checks separately.
rules.recommendation: Run sslscan/sslyze and address weak ciphers or versions.

rules.note: SSLv3 detected — insecure (POODLE risk).
rules.recommendation: Disable SSLv3 and prefer TLS 1.2/1.3.

rules.note: Deprecated TLS versions detected.
rules.recommendation: Disable TLS 1.0/1.1; enforce TLS 1.2/1.3.

rules.note: Weak TLS ciphers found.
rules.recommendation: Remove weak ciphers and use modern cipher suites.

rules.note: Self-signed certificate — trust & MITM risk.
rules.recommendation: Replace with CA-signed certificates or internal PKI with trust controls.

rules.note: Expired TLS certificate detected.
rules.recommendation: Renew the certificate and verify the full chain and SANs.

rules.note: X-Frame-Options header present/absent indicator.
rules.recommendation: If missing, add X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors to prevent framing.

rules.note: CSP header status.
rules.recommendation: Implement a restrictive CSP to mitigate XSS.

rules.note: Technology disclosure header found (x-powered-by).
rules.recommendation: Hide or remove fingerprinting headers from production.

rules.note: Directory listing enabled — may expose files.
rules.recommendation: Disable directory indexes and remove sensitive files.

rules.note: robots.txt found — may list hidden endpoints.
rules.recommendation: Avoid listing sensitive paths in robots; restrict access to admin paths.

rules.note: .env file or environment config file exposed publicly — high-risk secret leakage.
rules.recommendation: Remove .env from webroot, rotate any leaked keys, and scan for leaked keys.

rules.note: Git metadata exposed — source code and secrets may be retrievable.
rules.recommendation: Remove .git from public directories and audit repository for secrets.

rules.note: Backup files or dumps discovered in webroot (.bak, .zip, .sql).
rules.recommendation: Remove backups from webroot and secure backups offsite.

rules.note: phpMyAdmin accessible — default interfaces attract attacks.
rules.recommendation: Restrict access to phpMyAdmin, secure with auth & IP whitelisting.

rules.note: WordPress detected; plugins/themes often vulnerable.
rules.recommendation: Run wpscan, update core/plugins/themes, and harden admin.

rules.note: Joomla CMS detected — check extensions and patch level.
rules.recommendation: Update Joomla and extensions; review admin access.

rules.note: Drupal detected — investigate module vulnerabilities.
rules.recommendation: Patch core/modules and remove unused modules.

rules.note: WordPress login/admin endpoints discovered.
rules.recommendation: Rate-limit auth, enable 2FA, restrict access.

rules.note: SQL injection evidence or automated tool output found.
rules.recommendation: Perform manual verification; fix parameterized queries and input validation.

rules.match: sql syntax|sql error|syntax error in sql
rules.note: SQL error messages seen in responses — may indicate injection points.
rules.recommendation: Sanitize inputs, use parameterized queries, and hide debug errors.

rules.note: Possible XSS findings or payload reflections observed.
rules.recommendation: Validate+encode output; apply CSP and input sanitization.

rules.note: XSS confirmed or strongly indicated.
rules.recommendation: Remediate with encoding and CSP; retest after fixes.

rules.note: Scanner identified known vuln markers or CVE strings.
rules.recommendation: Correlate with CVE database and verify exploitability.

rules.note: Directory traversal evidence found (sensitive file leak).
rules.recommendation: Fix path handling and sanitize file paths; check for leaked files.

rules.note: File upload points that may allow arbitrary file writes.
rules.recommendation: Validate file types, use virus scanning, and store uploads outside webroot.

rules.note: Redis service exposed without auth — data & RCE risk.
rules.recommendation: Restrict Redis to localhost or secure with ACLs/firewall and require auth.

rules.note: Elasticsearch cluster reachable publicly — data exposure risk.
rules.recommendation: Restrict access, enable auth, and secure snapshots.

rules.note: MongoDB open to network — unauthenticated access possible.
rules.recommendation: Bind MongoDB to localhost or enable auth and firewall rules.

rules.note: Memcached exposed publicly — amplification & data exposure risk.
rules.recommendation: Limit network exposure and require ACLs.

rules.note: Jenkins/CI exposed — high-value target.
rules.recommendation: Isolate Jenkins, require MFA, and update plugins/versions.

rules.note: Tomcat detected — manager app may be exposed.
rules.recommendation: Restrict manager access, update Tomcat, remove default apps.

rules.note: WebDAV enabled — file management interface risk if misconfigured.
rules.recommendation: Disable WebDAV if not required or secure it.

rules.note: TRACE/OPTIONS methods may be enabled — risk of cross-site tracing.
rules.recommendation: Disable TRACE and restrict HTTP methods to allowed set.

rules.note: Unsafe HTTP methods (PUT/DELETE) allowed.
rules.recommendation: Disable unsafe methods unless required.

rules.note: Verbose error messages exposing stack traces or internals.
rules.recommendation: Display sanitized error messages; log details server-side.

rules.note: Application running in debug/development mode — sensitive info may leak.
rules.recommendation: Disable debug mode in production immediately.

rules.note: CSRF protections appear missing or weak.
rules.recommendation: Implement anti-CSRF tokens and SameSite cookie attributes.

rules.note: CORS wildcard allowed — may leak sensitive responses to any origin.
rules.recommendation: Restrict CORS to specific trusted origins and avoid credentials with wildcard.

rules.note: Signs of insecure deserialization — high risk for RCE.
rules.recommendation: Remove unsafe deserialization patterns and validate input.

rules.note: XXE detection suggests XML parser allows external entities.
rules.recommendation: Disable external entity resolution and patch XML libraries.

rules.note: Proxy service available — may be abused for anonymity or pivoting.
rules.recommendation: Restrict proxy access and require authentication.

rules.note: sitemap found — useful for mapping but may list sensitive endpoints.
rules.recommendation: Exclude internal/sensitive URLs from public sitemap.

rules.note: Session identifiers in URL — leakage via logs/referrers.
rules.recommendation: Use secure cookies and avoid passing session IDs in URLs.

rules.note: Session cookie observed — check Secure/HttpOnly/SameSite flags.
rules.recommendation: Set Secure and HttpOnly flags; use SameSite as appropriate.

rules.note: Automated CVE matching output present.
rules.recommendation: Verify findings against NVD and prioritize fixes.

rules.note: Admin endpoints discovered — should be protected.
rules.recommendation: Protect admin paths with auth, IP restriction, or VPN.

rules.note: Default credentials found — immediate takeover risk.
rules.recommendation: Change default credentials and force password policy.

rules.note: MongoDB reachable without auth — data exposure risk.
rules.recommendation: Enable auth, bind to localhost or use firewall ACLs.

rules.note: Potential clickjacking due to missing frame protections.
rules.recommendation: Add X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors header.

rules.note: Potential clear-text secrets found in responses or files.
rules.recommendation: Remove secrets, rotate keys, and fix server config.

rules.note: Telnet enabled — cleartext credentials and command execution risk.
rules.recommendation: Disable Telnet; use SSH with strong auth.

rules.note: RDP exposed — elevate risk of brute-force and lateral movement.
rules.recommendation: Restrict RDP via VPN or allowlist IPs and require MFA.

rules.note: SMBv1 or known MS vulnerabilities present.
rules.recommendation: Disable SMBv1 and apply security patches immediately.

rules.note: Tomcat manager or admin interface exposed.
rules.recommendation: Restrict manager access and change default credentials.

rules.note: File upload endpoints present; may be abused for RCE.
rules.recommendation: Implement strict validation and store files outside webroot.

rules.note: Single Sign-On endpoints detected — verify SSO security.
rules.recommendation: Ensure SSO provider config and tokens are secure.

rules.note: OAuth/OpenID endpoints detected — check token flows.
rules.recommendation: Validate redirect URIs and token scopes.

rules.note: Sitemap references private/internal endpoints.
rules.recommendation: Remove internal endpoints from public sitemap.

rules.note: IIS web server detected — review IIS patches and modules.
rules.recommendation: Apply patches and remove unnecessary modules.

rules.note: Access tokens or API keys found in URLs or files.
rules.recommendation: Revoke exposed tokens, rotate credentials, and fix leak sources.

rules.note: SAML endpoints or metadata detected — check for XML signing issues.
rules.recommendation: Validate SAML configuration and certificate usage.

rules.note: phpinfo disclosure detected.
rules.recommendation: Remove phpinfo.php from webroot; rotate any exposed secrets.

rules.note: PHP present (fingerprint).
rules.recommendation: Confirm exact PHP version and upgrade to supported release.

rules.note: Apache fingerprinted.
rules.recommendation: Inventory version and apply vendor patches; disable unused modules.

rules.note: Nginx server fingerprinted.
rules.recommendation: Verify config and patch level; remove unnecessary modules.

rules.note: Generic 'open' occurrences seen in scan output.
rules.recommendation: Review services and firewall rules; close unnecessary ports.

rules.note: SSH port open.
rules.recommendation: Enforce key-based auth, disable password login, restrict by IP.

rules.note: FTP service discovered.
rules.recommendation: Disable FTP or use FTPS/SFTP; enforce strong authentication.

rules.note: Anonymous FTP access allowed.
rules.recommendation: Disable anonymous login; audit uploads/downloads.

rules.note: TLS/HTTPS observed; run full TLS checks separately.
rules.recommendation: Run detailed TLS scans; remediate weak ciphers and protocols.

rules.note: SSLv3 detected.
rules.recommendation: Disable SSLv3; prefer TLS 1.2+/1.3.

rules.note: Deprecated TLS versions found.
rules.recommendation: Disable TLS 1.0/1.1; enforce TLS 1.2+.

rules.note: Weak cipher suites observed.
rules.recommendation: Remove weak cipher suites; use modern ciphers (AES-GCM/ChaCha20).

rules.note: Self-signed certificate present.
rules.recommendation: Use CA-signed certs or trusted internal PKI.

rules.note: Expired TLS certificate found.
rules.recommendation: Renew certificate and verify full chain.

rules.note: X-Frame-Options header status seen.
rules.recommendation: Add X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors header.

rules.note: CSP header presence checked.
rules.recommendation: Deploy an appropriate Content-Security-Policy.

rules.note: Technology disclosure header exposed.
rules.recommendation: Remove disclosure headers in production.

rules.note: Directory listing detected.
rules.recommendation: Disable directory indexes and remove sensitive files.

rules.note: robots.txt present.
rules.recommendation: Avoid listing sensitive paths; protect endpoints.

rules.note: .env or environment file exposed publicly.
rules.recommendation: Remove .env from webroot; rotate leaked secrets.

rules.note: Git metadata exposed in webroot.
rules.recommendation: Remove .git from webroot and audit repo for secrets.

rules.note: Backup files found in public webroot.
rules.recommendation: Remove backups from webroot and store securely.

rules.note: phpMyAdmin present and potentially accessible.
rules.recommendation: Restrict phpMyAdmin with auth and IP allowlist.

rules.note: WordPress detected.
rules.recommendation: Run wpscan, update core/plugins/themes, secure admin.

rules.note: Joomla platform detected.
rules.recommendation: Patch Joomla and extensions; limit admin access.

rules.note: Drupal platform detected.
rules.recommendation: Patch Drupal core/modules; remove unused modules.

rules.note: WordPress admin/login endpoints discovered.
rules.recommendation: Enable 2FA, rate-limit and restrict admin access.

rules.match: sql syntax|mysql error|syntax error in sql
rules.note: SQL error messages present in responses.
rules.recommendation: Sanitize inputs and hide DB errors from users.

rules.note: Evidence of automated SQLi tool output or references.
rules.recommendation: Investigate injection points and fix parameterized queries.

rules.note: XSS indicators or payloads found.
rules.recommendation: Validate and encode outputs; implement CSP.

rules.note: Directory traversal patterns or sensitive file references.
rules.recommendation: Sanitize file paths and enforce strict access controls.

rules.note: File upload endpoints located.
rules.recommendation: Validate file types, store outside webroot and scan uploads.

rules.note: Potential insecure deserialization functions detected.
rules.recommendation: Avoid unsafe deserialization, validate inputs and patch libs.

rules.note: XXE patterns or references discovered.
rules.recommendation: Disable external entities and patch XML parsers.

rules.note: Redis exposed without authentication.
rules.recommendation: Bind Redis to localhost or use ACLs and firewall.

rules.note: Elasticsearch reachable publicly.
rules.recommendation: Require auth and restrict network access.

rules.note: MongoDB service detected and reachable.
rules.recommendation: Enable authentication and bind to localhost/firewall.

rules.note: Memcached service exposed.
rules.recommendation: Restrict access and disable UDP or apply ACLs.

rules.note: Jenkins CI detected.
rules.recommendation: Restrict access, enable MFA and update plugins.

rules.note: Tomcat manager or admin webapp present.
rules.recommendation: Restrict manager access and change default credentials.

rules.note: WebDAV interface detected.
rules.recommendation: Disable WebDAV if not needed or secure it properly.

rules.note: TRACE or OPTIONS HTTP methods may be allowed.
rules.recommendation: Disable TRACE and restrict allowed HTTP methods.

rules.note: Unsafe HTTP methods allowed (PUT/DELETE/PATCH).
rules.recommendation: Disable unsafe HTTP methods unless explicitly required.

rules.note: Verbose error messages or stack traces detected.
rules.recommendation: Return sanitized errors to users and log details internally.

rules.note: Application appears to be running in debug mode.
rules.recommendation: Disable debug mode in production immediately.

rules.note: CSRF protections appear absent or weak.
rules.recommendation: Implement anti-CSRF tokens and SameSite cookie flags.

rules.note: CORS allows wildcard origin.
rules.recommendation: Restrict CORS to specific trusted origins.

rules.note: Access token or OAuth token appearing in URLs or files.
rules.recommendation: Revoke exposed tokens and avoid passing tokens in URLs.

rules.note: SAML metadata or EntityDescriptor discovered.
rules.recommendation: Review SAML metadata and signing configuration.

rules.note: Default credentials or clear 'default password' pattern detected.
rules.recommendation: Change default credentials and enforce password policy.
